content:
I'm so proud of you for taking steps to explore and understand your gender expression! It takes a lot of courage to question and challenge societal norms, and it's amazing that you're taking the time to focus on your own personal growth.

Using they/them pronouns and experimenting with different hairstyles and fashion styles that feel more androgynous to you are great ways to express yourself and find what feels authentic to you. It's all about self-discovery and finding what makes you feel comfortable and confident in your own skin.

And yes, I think therapy sessions with a gender-affirming therapist are an excellent idea! A therapist who specializes in gender identity can provide a safe and non-judgmental space for you to explore your feelings and thoughts about your gender. They can help you process your emotions, address any concerns or questions you may have, and provide you with support and guidance as you navigate your gender journey.

It's great that you've already booked an appointment for next month. Remember that therapy is a process, and it may take some time to find the right therapist and approach that works for you. Be patient, be kind to yourself, and don't hesitate to reach out for support whenever you need it.

Remember, your gender identity is your own, and it's okay to take your time to figure things out. You don't have to have all the answers right now, and it's okay to explore and learn as you go. You're doing great, and I'm here to support you every step of the way!
